definition: Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown

sentences.english: Allen Lee Peng-fei recently became the third Hong Kong radio personality to go off the air.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬飛是香港最近封咪的第三位電臺主持。

sentences.english: Li Peng looks as if he will be confirmed as China's acting prime minister soon.
sentences.chinese: 看起來李鵬將被證實不久會成爲中國國務院代總理。

sentences.english: Chinese Premier Li Peng attended the first Asia-Europe summit.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬總理出席了首屆亞歐首腦會議。

sentences.english: Mr. Li Peng GM of Guangzhou UGARDEN Investment Co. , Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬，男，廣州市友家投資有限公司總經理。

sentences.english: Li extended a welcome to Kabila for his visit and spoke highly of Sino-DRC relations.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬歡迎卡比拉來華訪問，並積極評價中剛雙邊關係。

sentences.english: Mr Lee is one of three Hong Kong radio hosts to go off the air in recent weeks after claiming that they were under threat.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬飛是三位最近聲稱備受壓力而辭職的名嘴之一。

sentences.english: Chairman Li extended a warm welcome to Bouteflika.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬委員長對總統訪華表示熱烈歡迎。

sentences.english: Kyprioanou asked Hu to convey his cordial greetings to Chairman Li Peng.
sentences.chinese: 基普里亞努請胡錦濤轉達對李鵬委員長的親切問候。

sentences.english: Li Peng has worked for Hua Dan for over a year.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬在花旦公司已經工作了一年多。

sentences.english: Li first warmly congratulated Tito on the success of his second visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬首先熱烈祝賀斯托第二次訪華獲得成功。

sentences.english: Li Xiaopeng was born in 1959 in the former Chinese Premier Li Peng's son.
sentences.chinese: 1959年出生的李小鵬是前國務院總理李鵬的長子。

sentences.english: Hu conveyed the cordial greetings from NPC Chairman Li Peng to Majali and Rifaee respectively.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤分別向兩位議長轉達了李鵬委員長的親切問候。

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Zuo4 jia1 Xie2 hui4

definition: Yuan T. Lee (1936-), Taiwanese-born Chemist and Nobel Prize winner in 1986

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4
Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3

definition: a tax declaration form/a tax return
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
